result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:07 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Courtney J Shattuck in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Courtney J Shattuck.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Wang provides an update; she recently filed a motion to suppress and is asking the matter be set for formal hearing on her motion.  Atty. Wang believes the hearing will take about 1 hour.  State agrees.  Court adjourns for motion hearing on Defendant's Motion to Suppress.
Motion hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Defense Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence filed by Atty Wang.
Hearing on October 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:27 AM ; Case called for Arraignment.  Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Courtney J Shattuck in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Courtney J Shattuck. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty. Wang provides an update, she has discovery and needs additional time to review it with her client.  Atty. Wang is requesting a further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Arraignment on August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

01:02 PM Defendant Courtney J Shattuck in court with attorney Angela Wang.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  State to file an information.  Attorney Wang is asking for an arraignment date before the Trial Court.  The Court will set this matter for arraignment.  Arraignment scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Wang.

Hearing on July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with drug testing through WCS.  Drug testing frequency pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols.  Defendant to pay costs associated with drug testing.  Defendant to report to WCS within 2 business days after their release from custody.

02:23 PM Defendant Courtney J Shattuck in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
